problem: Given the polynomial equation $(5x-3)(4x+7) - 3(3x+2)(5x-1) + 2 = -25x^2 + bx + c$, find the values of and $c$.
solution: First expand the expressions. For $(5x-3)(4x+7) = 20x^2 + 35x - 12x - 21 = 20x^2 + 23x - 21$. For $3(3x+2)(5x-1) = 3(15x^2 - 3x + 10x - 2) = 3(15x^2 + 7x - 2) = 45x^2 + 21x - 6$. Subtract and add the constant, we get $(20x^2 + 23x - 21) - (45x^2 + 21x - 6) + 2 = -25x^2 + 2x - 13$. Therefore, $b = 2$ and $c = \boxed{-13}$.
